conclusion: Analyze the v-t graph to determine if the difference in displacement is continuously increasing.
The graph shows two velocity-time curves for objects A and B.
The area under each curve represents the displacement of the object over time.
The difference in displacement between A and B is represented by the shaded area between the two curves.
Initially, both objects start from the same point (at t = 0).
The shaded area increases as time progresses from 0 to t1.
This indicates that the difference in displacement between A and B is increasing over time.
Object A has a higher velocity than object B from 0 to t1.
Velocity is the rate of change of displacement.
A higher velocity means a greater rate of displacement.
As time progresses, the difference in displacement between A and B increases continuously because A is moving faster than B throughout the interval.
Yes, the difference in displacement between the two objects is continuously increasing from 0 to t1.
